Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Gateway ("reverse proxy", "accelerator") Cache
 Implementations
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=216431451; y=WoKmfmCX_CzOKdy5dIG4QqPp5abEXSOPyf8yQLuq3kPmFV0
X-Yahoo-Profile: rtomayko

Eric J. Bowman wrote:
> Ryan Tomayko wrote:
>> I'd like to compile a list of gateway proxy cache implementations. I'm
>> interested in anything that can plop down in front of an origin
>> server and use the basic freshness and/or validation mechanisms
>> defined in RFC 2616 Section 13 to serve up cached representations of
>> resources generated by the origin (e.g., things that describe
>> themselves as a "reverse proxy cache", "accelerator", or "surrogate
>> cache").
>>
> 
> Perhaps, if you find enough examples to warrant it, you could split the
> matrix into standalone cache components (reverse proxy with squid), and
> cache connectors for server components (Apache w/ mod_cache).

Sure will.

> One for the second category is Resin Pro, 

Great. I assume this is it?:

http://caucho.com/resin/doc/proxy-cache.xtp

> which meets all your criteria, unless you're restricting to open-source?

Nope. Non-free stuff is fine for my purposes. The goal is to see how 
widespread support is for some of the more interesting caching features 
(like validation / invalidation) in modern systems. I figure non-free 
software will be around for a few more years <grin> so I still include 
it in my definition of "modern".

> If not, there are also plenty of appliances to consider, such as:
> 
> http://www.juniper.net/products_and_services/app_performance.html

That's perfect. Thanks.

Ryan
